ygData.subject: RE: Another Question about  Fear
ygData.msgSnippet: So if you back away from a MOB does it follow you. If it did n t that would make sense. It is supposed to be blind after all. That might give you time to do a
ygData.messageBody:
So if you back away from a MOB does it follow you. If it did n't that would
make sense.
It is supposed to be blind after all.
That might give you time to do a heal or too before getting back into the
fray.

Always looking for alternative tactics. FOL 12 Mana Vs 40 for Fear.

Does it have a strong resist rate?

-----Original Message-----
From: Harry Katz [mailto:hkatz@...]
Sent: Friday, July 16, 1999 11:20 AM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Another Question about Fear


From: Harry Katz <hkatz@...>

FOL will temporarily blind your opponent (obviously).....but that doesnt
stop them from swinging their weapon...if they are in range to hit you,
they will. I have found that against npcs FOL is pretty useless, they seem
to hit just as much, and it doesnt seem to last very long. As stated
earlier, PvP is where it is really useful....they dont stop their attack,
but you can run away, and they will have no idea where you went...pretty
good if you have to escape, or you just wanna buy a little time.

Dank Skunksage
the Rathe




At 11:03 AM 7/16/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: Chas Watkins <cwatkins@...>
>
>So you FOL but what does it do?
>
>Does the MOB temporarily stop his attack.
>In a PvP does the other PC have to stop his attack. Or can he stand still
>melee away or keep blasting you?
>
>V.interested
>
>Regards
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Rejection Kills. Disappointment Only Maims
>[mailto:douglas@...]
>Sent: Friday, July 16, 1999 11:00 AM
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Another Question about Fear
>
>
>From: "Rejection Kills. Disappointment Only Maims" <douglas@...>
>
>On Fri, 16 Jul 1999, Slithey Tove wrote:
>
>> Can you discuss a little how you use Flash of Light? I bought it, I don't
>> think I have ever used it. I have seen it written that is is mainly good
>for
>> PvP, which I don't do. How does it work against monsters?
>
>Actually, it IS most effective in a PvP situation, but even against
>monsters, it's useful 'til about level 9 or so when you get Furor. =)
>Flash of light to blind, then heal your compeers.
>
>In a fight, however, it's not THAT effective as an offensive tool -
>again, it's PvP where it shines. Against beasties, you CAN FoL and then
>fear them, but they always know exactly where to come back.
>--
>We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind
>us, with nothing to show for our progress but the memory of the smell
>of smoke and the presumption that once our eyes watered.
>
>
